Description: The temptation of St Antony; the saint attacked by a group of devils; the bell and a book on the ground at left; early impression, blank on verso. Woodcut
Curator's comments: The woodcut first used in an unidentified publication by Egenolph in Frankfurt in the 1550s.
Bibliographic references: Dodgson 1903, 1911 / Catalogue of Early German and Flemish Woodcuts in the BM, 2 vols (II.163.15)
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
